title: Do not put money into this game.
body:
Ok, after spending a lot of time and money into this game. I have realized it is ok to put time into it. Ok it is a fun game.

But do not put money into it, as at any time, they can just perma ban your account. And you lose everything. 

Losing the time isn't so bad. You were going to keep playing it anyway. But losing the money is just a kick in the face. And they seem to just perma ban people at random. I know of atleast 3 people who have been banned, even tho they did not break "community rules"

The way their report system works is, if enough people report you after a game. No one looks at it. It is all automated. Play bad in a team of premade players. They all report you. And you get punished because they didn't like you.

So again. Put your time into this game. But not your money.

replies.body: Plz don’t tell bs lies. 99% of the time the players getting banned deserve it. The other 1% can easily send in a support ticket and get their accounts back it’s not hard.

I've been the 5th added to a pre-made of 4, where they all trolled me to ruin my game, and reported me afterwards.
Nothing happened.

Why? BECAUSE THAT'S NOT HOW IT WORKS.
Don't tell me how to live my life
my friend got banned without breaking any guidelines sent in a ticket to support and discussed it with them  and got unbanned so dont lie

Exactly, Just like your friend got banned for no reason, I have been banned for no reason. Except  I can't seem to get the attention of an actual human to review the case. It's just an automated system. But thank you for agreeing with me that it does happen.

I'm just glad that most of the RP I spent on this game was purchased using mobile phone credit, that would have otherwise gone to waste. 

Perma banning peoples accounts just seems a bit over the top. Especially over players just not liking eachother.

>The way their report system works is, if enough people report you after a game. No one looks at it. It is all automated. Play bad in a team of premade players. They all report you. And you get punished because they didn't like you.

Entirely untrue. It only takes 1 report to review someone's chat logs. It was likely designed this way specifically to avoid the situations you described.
